Class GameLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.GameLogic

  • public class GameLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    Feb 15, 2014 This class handles the logic behind this implementation of the classic game Mine Sweeper
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Marcus Gabilheri

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameLogic

        public GameLogic()
        Empty Constructor

      • GameLogic

        public GameLogic(int level,
         int row,
         int col,
         int bombs)
        Constructor were the user can specify how many cells and how many bombs he wants
        Parameters:
        row - number of rows
        col - number of cells
        bombs - number of rows

      • GameLogic

        public GameLogic(int level)
        Constructor based on the level chosen for the game. takes 4 main options EASY = 9x9 with 10 bombs MEDIUM = 15x15 with 20 bombs HARD = 20x20 with 30 bombs EXPERT = 25x25 with 40 bombs
        Parameters:
        level - the level of the game

      • move

        public int move(int row,
       int col,
       boolean isFirstTime)
        Handles whenever the player makes a move to a specific cell
        Parameters:
        row - the specific row for this move
        col - the specific column for this move
        isFirstTime - boolean if is the first time that the player is playing will not check for bombs in that spot
        Returns:
        int the number of surrounding bombs or the a bomb

      • setFlag

              int col)

        Parameters:

        col - the specific col for this move
